title.justification: This is the official title of the paper provided at the beginning.

extractions.description: This paper presents the performance and methods of SORBETMatcher, a schema matching system using SORBET Embeddings, in the OAEI 2023 competition.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental results from the OAEI 2023 competition, making it an empirical study.
type.quote: Overall, SORBETMatcher achieved a top performance in some of the tracks while still having some improvements to be made on others.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on ontology alignment using large language models and embeddings.
name.quote: SORBETMatcher is a schema matching system for both equivalence matching and subsumption matching.

name.justification: SORBETMatcher leverages large language models (LLM) and embeddings for ontology alignment, which falls under representation learning.
name.quote: SORBET is a novel ontology embedding method that leverages large language models.

name.justification: The model discussed and evaluated throughout the paper is named SORBETMatcher.
name.quote: SORBETMatcher is a schema matching system for both equivalence matching and subsumption matching.

is_contributed.justification: SORBETMatcher appears to be the main contribution of the paper in the context of the OAEI 2023 competition.
is_contributed.quote: The purpose of SORBETMatcher is to leverage those embeddings to create an ontology matcher that offers a simple, yet powerful and generalizable approach.

is_executed.justification: The entire paper revolves around the implementation and execution of the SORBETMatcher model.
is_executed.quote: Overall, SORBETMatcher achieved a top performance in some of the tracks while still having some improvements to be made on others.

is_compared.justification: SORBETMatcher's performance is compared with other systems in the OAEI 2023 competition.
is_compared.quote: In comparison to other systems in this year’s competition, SORBET obtained the 3rd position out of 9 based on the F1 score.

referenced_paper_title.value: SORBET: A Siamese Network for Ontology Embeddings Using a Distance-Based Regression Loss and BERT
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title for SORBETMatcher is included in the references section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: [4] Francis Gosselin and Amal Zouaq. “SORBET: A Siamese Network for Ontology Embeddings Using a Distance-Based Regression Loss and BERT”.

name.justification: Bio-ML is one of the main datasets used for evaluation in the paper.
name.quote: It emerged as the leading system in three out of the five subsumption matching challenges within the Bio-ML track.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a specific reference title for the Bio-ML dataset.

name.justification: Anatomy is another dataset used for evaluation in the paper.
name.quote: The anatomy track involves aligning the Adult Mouse Anatomy (MA) with the NCI Thesaurus, which describes Human Anatomy (NCI).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a specific reference title for the Anatomy dataset.

name.justification: Conference dataset is used for evaluation in the paper.
name.quote: The conference track involves aligning a set of ontologies that describe the domain of conference organization.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a specific reference title for the Conference dataset.

name.justification: SentenceBERT is used as the base model for creating SORBET embeddings.
name.quote: SORBET fine-tunes SentenceBERT, a pre-trained siamese BERT model

referenced_paper_title.value: Sentence-BERT: Sentence Embeddings using Siamese BERT-Networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The exact paper title for SentenceBERT is found in the references section.
referenced_paper_title.quote: [8] Nils Reimers and Iryna Gurevych. “Sentence-BERT: Sentence Embeddings using Siamese BERT-Networks”.
